alert.note: Alert for Butler; Clarion; Forest; Venango (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 25 at 3:25PM EDT until March 25 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Venango County in northwestern Pennsylvania... North central Butler County in west central Pennsylvania... Northwestern Clarion County in west central Pennsylvania... Western Forest County in northwestern Pennsylvania... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 325 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Sugarcreek to near Slippery Rock, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Oil City, Franklin, Sugarcreek, Tionesta, Hasson Heights, Seneca, Harrisville, Polk, Rouseville, Clintonville, Cooperstown, and Kennerdell. This includes Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 29 and 40. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
